title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the answer

1 point is earned for the justification

Since f'(x)>0 on the intervals -4<x<-2 and -2<x<3 ln( 5 3 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AED@ , f is increasing on the interval -4 ≤ x ≤ 3 ln( 5 3 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AED@ .

Since f'(x)<0 on the interval 3 ln( 5 3 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AED@ <x<4, f is decreasing on the interval 3 ln( 5 3 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AED@ ≤ x ≤ 4.

Therefore, f has an absolute maximum at x=3 ln( 5 3 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AED@ .
